  • about twitter

interested in software studies, philosophy of information, complex socio-technical systems, human-machine ecologies.

this blog makes up a palette of looseleaf writing snippets - little blocks of writings on topics i find illumining. sometimes ordered, mostly not. weaving together convergences across humanities, critical theory and computer science.

About Me

currently building up a practice across theory & our technical milieau. in my day job, i think about thought leadership and policy directions for human and machine collaboration systems in Singapore and blockchain consortia governance. with a media studies and social science background, i seek to unearth interplays between these fields and cohere some research inquiries.

other times, i help with marketing & partnerships at CodingGirls SG.

tangentially, i'm also interested in and engage with topics in: consciousness, AI/machine ethics, theoretical physics, ecosophy, creative coding & computational creativity.

most of the text here is autodidactic. words might be clumsy. so form a study/reading group with me(!), or talk to me about anything at vanessaauraphin@gmail.com.
